dbq_name: Sinusitis, Rhinitis, and Other Conditions of the Nose, Throat, Larynx and Pharynx

levels.criteria: Without polyps, but with greater than 50% obstruction of nasal passage on both sides or complete obstruction on one side

vasomotor_rhinitis.description: Non-allergic rhinitis triggered by various stimuli

levels.criteria: One or two incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis requiring prolonged (lasting four to six weeks) antibiotic treatment, or three to six non-incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis characterized by headaches, pain, and purulent discharge or crusting

Three or more incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis requiring prolonged (lasting four to six weeks) antibiotic treatment, or more than six non-incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis characterized by headaches, pain, and purulent discharge or crusting

Following radical surgery with chronic osteomyelitis, or near constant sinusitis characterized by headaches, pain and tenderness of affected sinus, and purulent discharge or crusting after repeated surgeries
Traumatic deviation with 50% obstruction of nasal passage on both sides or complete obstruction on one side

loss_of_smell.anosmia: Complete loss of sense of smell

incapacitating_episode.description: Episode requiring bed rest and treatment by a physician
incapacitating_episode.note: Typically involves severe symptoms requiring medical intervention

non_incapacitating_episode.description: Episode characterized by headaches, pain, and purulent discharge or crusting
non_incapacitating_episode.note: Does not require bed rest but causes significant symptoms

rhinitis_as_secondary_to.connection: Burn pits, dust, chemicals during service

sleep_apnea_connection.description: Rhinitis/sinusitis can cause or aggravate sleep apnea
sleep_apnea_connection.mechanism: Nasal obstruction contributes to upper airway problems
sleep_apnea_connection.claim_tip: If you have sinusitis/rhinitis AND sleep apnea, consider secondary connection

headaches_connection.claim_tip: Can claim headaches as secondary to sinusitis

burn_pit_exposure.applies_to: Veterans with qualifying service under PACT Act
burn_pit_exposure.note: PACT Act made certain respiratory conditions presumptive for burn pit exposure

tips_for_veterans: Document ALL sinus/rhinitis episodes throughout the year
Keep records of antibiotic prescriptions and duration
Track how many days you're incapacitated by sinus problems
Describe severity of symptoms - headaches, pain, discharge
Mention if you've had sinus surgery
Report any loss or reduction of smell
Document nasal obstruction percentage if known
Mention if you have nasal polyps
Describe how condition affects daily life and work
If exposed to burn pits, document that exposure
Connect to sleep apnea if applicable
common_mistakes: Not tracking number of episodes per year
Failing to document antibiotic treatment duration
Not distinguishing incapacitating from non-incapacitating episodes
Forgetting to report loss of smell
Not connecting to potential secondary conditions

episode_tracking_tip.description: Keep a log throughout the year
episode_tracking_tip.why: Rating depends heavily on NUMBER of episodes per year

important_notes: Rating depends on frequency of episodes - TRACK THEM
Incapacitating vs non-incapacitating episodes have different thresholds
Polyps automatically warrant 30% for allergic rhinitis
Rhinitis/sinusitis presumptive under PACT Act for burn pit exposure
Can contribute to or aggravate sleep apnea
